snippet: Shira A. Scheindlin, who became a federal judge in 1994, said ex-Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and ex-Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly “didn’t seem to get” the effect the policy had.
abstract: Federal Judge Shira A Scheindlin, who is stepping down after 22 years on bench, discusses her 2013 ruling that New York City Police Department's stop-and-frisk policy violated minorities' rights; shares her perceptions that former Mayor Michael Bloomberg and former Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly did not have an understanding of how policies, based on racial profiling, have deep and long-lasting negative impact on New York communities and neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: Shira A. Scheindlin, who became a federal judge in 1994, said ex-Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and ex-Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly “didn’t seem to get” the effect the policy had.

headline.main: Departing Judge Offers Blunt Defense of Ruling in Stop-and-Frisk Case
headline.print_headline: Stop-and-Frisk Judge Says Bloomberg and Kelly ‘Didn’t Seem to Get It’
